speaker: Carlos
text: Morning, everyone. Let’s keep it quick. What are you working on today?
ipa: ˈmɔrnɪŋ ˈɛvrɪwʌn | lɛts kiːp ɪt kwɪk | wʌt ɑr ju ˈwɝkɪŋ ɑn təˈdeɪ
stress: MORNING, EVERYONE | LET’S KEEP IT QUICK | WHAT ARE YOU WORKING ON TODAY
linking:
"keep it" → /kiːp ɪt/ (p links into it)
"working on" → /ˈwɝkɪŋ ɑn/ (verb + preposition)
"on today" → /ɑn təˈdeɪ/ (on links into to)

speaker: You
text: Hey! I’m finishing up the validation logic for the new form. After that, I’m going to start writing unit tests.
ipa: heɪ | aɪm ˈfɪnɪʃɪŋ ʌp ðə ˌvæləˈdeɪʃən ˈlɑːʤɪk fər ðə nuː fɔrm | ˈæftɚ ðæt aɪm ˈɡoʊɪŋ tə stɑrt ˈraɪtɪŋ ˈjuːnɪt tɛsts
stress: HEY | I’M FINISHING UP THE VALIDATION LOGIC | FOR THE NEW FORM | AFTER THAT | I’M GOING TO START WRITING UNIT TESTS
linking:
"finishing up" → /ˈfɪnɪʃɪŋ ʌp/ (smooth link)
"going to" → /ˈɡoʊɪŋ tə/ (to reduced)
"start writing" → /stɑrt ˈraɪtɪŋ/ (t links into R)

speaker: Carlos
text: Nice. Do you think you'll have time to push everything today?
ipa: naɪs | dʊ jə θɪŋk juːl hæv taɪm tə pʊʃ ˈɛvrɪθɪŋ təˈdeɪ
stress: NICE | DO YOU THINK YOU’LL HAVE TIME TO PUSH EVERYTHING TODAY
linking:
"do you" → /dʊ jə/ (do you reduced)
"you’ll have" → /juːl hæv/ (contracted ‘you will’)
"time to" → /taɪm tə/ (to reduced)

speaker: You
text: I hope so. I will probably submit the PR by 5 PM if nothing unexpected comes up.
ipa: aɪ hoʊp soʊ | aɪ wɪl ˈprɑːbəbli səbˈmɪt ðə piː ɑr baɪ faɪv piː ɛm | ɪf ˈnʌθɪŋ ˌʌnɪkˈspɛktɪd kʌmz ʌp
stress: I HOPE SO | I WILL PROBABLY SUBMIT THE PR BY FIVE PM | IF NOTHING UNEXPECTED COMES UP
linking:
"will probably" → /wɪl ˈprɑːbəbli/ (will links to adverb)
"submit the" → /səbˈmɪt ðə/ (t links into article)
"comes up" → /kʌmz ʌp/ (z links into vowel)

speaker: Dana
text: Heads-up, I’m about to merge the layout refactor. It might affect your form styling.
ipa: hɛdz ʌp | aɪm əˈbaʊt tə mɝːʤ ðə ˈleɪ.aʊt riˈfæktɚ | ɪt maɪt əˈfɛkt jɚ fɔrm ˈstaɪlɪŋ
stress: HEADS-UP | I’M ABOUT TO MERGE THE LAYOUT REFACTOR | IT MIGHT AFFECT YOUR FORM STYLING
linking:
"about to" → /əˈbaʊt tə/ (to reduced)
"affect your" → /əˈfɛkt jɚ/ (smooth consonant to pronoun)

speaker: You
text: Got it! I’ll double-check once you’ve merged it. If needed, I will adjust the styles before pushing.
ipa: ɡɑt ɪt | aɪl ˈdʌbəl ʧɛk wʌns juv mɝrdʒd ɪt | ɪf ˈniːdɪd | aɪ wɪl əˈʤʌst ðə staɪlz bɪˈfɔːr ˈpʊʃɪŋ
stress: GOT IT | I’LL DOUBLE-CHECK ONCE YOU’VE MERGED IT | IF NEEDED | I WILL ADJUST THE STYLES BEFORE PUSHING
linking:
"once you’ve" → /wʌns juv/ (you have contracted)
"merged it" → /mɝrdʒd ɪt/ (d links into it)
"adjust the" → /əˈʤʌst ðə/ (smooth verb + article)

speaker: Carlos
text: Great teamwork. Tomorrow we have that mini demo with stakeholders, right?
ipa: ɡreɪt ˈtiːmwɝk | təˈmɑːroʊ wi hæv ðæt ˈmɪni ˈdɛmoʊ wɪð ˈsteɪkˌhoʊldɚz | raɪt
stress: GREAT TEAMWORK | TOMORROW WE HAVE THAT MINI DEMO WITH STAKEHOLDERS | RIGHT?
linking:
"have that" → /hæv ðæt/ (v links to that)
"demo with" → /ˈdɛmoʊ wɪð/ (smooth connection)

speaker: You
text: Yeah, I am meeting with Matt later today to review the demo flow. We’re going to do a quick run-through.
ipa: jæ | aɪ əm ˈmiːtɪŋ wɪð mæt ˈleɪtɚ təˈdeɪ tə rɪˈvju ðə ˈdɛmoʊ floʊ | wɪr ˈɡoʊɪŋ tə du ə kwɪk ˈrʌnθruː
stress: YEAH | I AM MEETING WITH MATT LATER TODAY TO REVIEW THE DEMO FLOW | WE’RE GOING TO DO A QUICK RUN-THROUGH
linking:
"meeting with" → /ˈmiːtɪŋ wɪð/ (verb + preposition)
"going to do" → /ˈɡoʊɪŋ tə du/ (to reduced)
"quick run-through" → /kwɪk ˈrʌnθruː/ (ck links into next noun)

speaker: Carlos
text: Cool. Hopefully by the time we meet tomorrow, you will have finalized the demo version.
ipa: kuːl | ˈhoʊpfəli baɪ ðə taɪm wi miːt təˈmɑːroʊ | ju wɪl həv ˈfaɪnəˌlaɪzd ðə ˈdɛmoʊ ˈvɝːʒən
stress: COOL | HOPEFULLY BY THE TIME WE MEET TOMORROW | YOU WILL HAVE FINALIZED THE DEMO VERSION
linking:
"will have" → /wɪl həv/ (have reduced)
"finalized the" → /ˈfaɪnəˌlaɪzd ðə/ (d links to article)

speaker: You
text: Absolutely. I will be wrapping up everything this evening.
ipa: ˌæbsəˈluːtli | aɪ wɪl bi ˈræpɪŋ ʌp ˈɛvrɪθɪŋ ðɪs ˈivnɪŋ
stress: ABSOLUTELY | I WILL BE WRAPPING UP EVERYTHING THIS EVENING
linking:
"wrapping up" → /ˈræpɪŋ ʌp/ (smooth phrasal verb)
"this evening" → /ðɪs ˈivnɪŋ/ (s links into vowel)

speaker: Carlos
text: Awesome. Reminder: the CI/CD maintenance starts Thursday at 9 AM, so let’s avoid pushing that morning.
ipa: ˈɔːsəm | rɪˈmaɪndɚ | ðə si aɪ si di ˈmeɪntənəns stɑrts ˈθɝzdeɪ ət naɪn ˈeɪɛm | soʊ lɛts əˈvɔɪd ˈpʊʃɪŋ ðæt ˈmɔrnɪŋ
stress: AWESOME | REMINDER | MAINTENANCE STARTS THURSDAY AT NINE AM | SO LET’S AVOID PUSHING THAT MORNING
linking:
"starts Thursday" → /stɑrts ˈθɝzdeɪ/ (T links to voiced TH)
"avoid pushing" → /əˈvɔɪd ˈpʊʃɪŋ/ (d links to verb)

speaker: You
text: Noted. I’m planning to push all changes by Wednesday night. That way, we won’t run into any delays.
ipa: ˈnoʊtɪd | aɪm ˈplænɪŋ tə pʊʃ ɔl ˈʧeɪndʒɪz baɪ ˈwɛnzdeɪ naɪt | ðæt weɪ wi woʊnt rʌn ˈɪntu ˈɛni dɪˈleɪz
stress: NOTED | I’M PLANNING TO PUSH ALL CHANGES BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT | THAT WAY WE WON’T RUN INTO ANY DELAYS
linking:
"planning to" → /ˈplænɪŋ tə/ (to reduced)
"run into" → /rʌn ˈɪntu/ (run links to preposition)

speaker: Carlos
text: Perfect. That’s all from me — let’s crush it!
ipa: ˈpɝːfɪkt | ðæts ɔl frəm mi | lɛts krʌʃ ɪt
stress: PERFECT | THAT’S ALL FROM ME | LET’S CRUSH IT
linking:
"from me" → /frəm mi/ (m links into pronoun)
"crush it" → /krʌʃ ɪt/ (sh links to vowel)
